subject: Marketing
title: The Contrast Principle
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Contrast Principle.

hook.text: Real estate agents show a terrible house first. The next house always looks amazing.

buildup.text: The contrast principle says value is judged relative to what came immediately before.

discovery.text: Showing an overpriced option first makes the target option feel like a smart deal.

twist.text: The terrible house was never meant to sell. It was a psychological prop.

climax.text: Skilled sellers control the sequence of options to engineer the desired comparison.

punchline.text: What you show first changes what they choose.

quiz.question: Why do real estate agents sometimes show a bad house first?
options: It makes the next house look much better by contrast
They are required to show all available listings
Bad houses are easier to sell at high prices
